info.title: ActionHub.ai API
info.description:
# Introduction
_Improve user engagement with real-time "Next Best Action" recommendations using ActionHub.ai from Lifecycle Science._
ActionHub delivers consumer action recommendations,
message orchestration, and content personalization in a variety of 
marketing and product development use cases. ActionHub uses
anonymized event logging to optimize category and asset recommendations for any
user based on their own engagement history.
The ActionHub API provides authenticated systems with program owners access to 
the real-time retention and engagement engine built by Lifecycle Science. 

Only two API call integrations are needed to get started:

1. `[POST] /events` for logging user engagement events
1. `[GET] /users/<user_id>/actions` to retrieve user recommended actions.


All of the other API resources available in the ActionHub system provide optional configuration and optimization features.
An API Key and Program ID are necessary to access the API. Contact Lifecycle Science support to obtain.

post.description:
Add _N_ events to the event store. New events trigger updates to user action
recommendations and label weights. (See _Post Event Batch_ to add more than one event per call.)

parameters.description:
- `true` (default) : Process user updates in background, very fast response (ack)  
- `false` : Process user updates and produce new action recommendations immediately, 
slightly longer response time, guaranteed user update

schema.title: Queue Updates
schema.description:
- `true` (default) : Process user updates in background, very fast response (ack)  
- `false` : Process user updates and produce new action recommendations immediately, 
slightly longer response time, guaranteed user update

parameters.name: queue_updates

parameters.description:
- `true` (default) : Process updated action recommendations for event users.
Use this option for real-time event logging and action feedback
- `false` : Do not process updated action recommendations for event users. 
Use this option for bulk loading or back-filling a large number of events

schema.title: Process User Actions
schema.description:
- `true` (default) : Process updated action recommendations for event users.
Use this option for real-time event logging and action feedback
- `false` : Do not process updated action recommendations for event users. 
Use this option for bulk loading or back-filling a large number of events

parameters.name: process_user_actions

get.description:
*Get a list recommended actions for a given user.* Actions are weighted by
expected impact. Higher weights means greater expected impact.

parameters.description: Number of actions to be returned in result

schema.title: Limit
schema.description: Number of actions to be returned in result

parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Include actions already taken? Default is true (1)

schema.title: Allow Repeats
schema.description: Include actions already taken? Default is true (1)

parameters.name: allow_repeats

get.description:
Get a collection of labels and their weights used in recommendations for the given user.
The higher weight values indicate higher user engagement.
Results are order by highest-lowest weight values.
Get the raw action history log for the given user.

Retrieve a random user from the event store.
This method should be used for configuration QA purposes only.
(i.e. select a random user and then evaluate actions
against histories and label weights
to verify proper set up.)

schema.title: Response Get Random User Random User Id Get

get.description: Retrieve the assets used in a given program

parameters.description: Term will be searched for in any field

schema.title: Search
schema.description: Term will be searched for in any field

parameters.name: search

post.description: Upsert function will either add new asset to program, or update existing asset with the same asset_id

get.description: Retrieve the assets used in a given program

parameters.description: Term will be searched for in any field

schema.title: Search
schema.description: Term will be searched for in any field

parameters.name: search

put.description: Upsert function will either add new asset to program, or update existing asset with the same asset_id

get.description: Get the program configuration settings used in processing and reporting events and actions.

put.description:
Re-calculate the base/global models used in action recommendations.
In most cases, this should be done no more than once per 24 hours
when (a) new products/actions/services are added to the global event store,
or (b) program configuration changes have been posted and are ready for publishing.
Individual user data is not impacted by this process.
**NOTE: this action may take up to 60 seconds to complete**

get.description: Get the program configuration settings used in processing and reporting events and actions.

put.description: Update the program configuration settings used in processing and reporting events and actions.

get.description: Get plaintext list of user_ids matching segment criteria.

parameters.description:
Optional comma delimited list of recommended asset ids to include in the segment.
The supplied list of assets will be treated as an "OR" list, so any user matching 
*any* asset recommendation will be included in the segment.

schema.title: Asset Ids
schema.description:
Optional comma delimited list of recommended asset ids to include in the segment.
The supplied list of assets will be treated as an "OR" list, so any user matching 
*any* asset recommendation will be included in the segment.

parameters.name: asset_ids

parameters.description:
Optional comma delimited list of relevant labels to include in the segment.
The supplied list of assets will be treated as an "AND" list, so only users
matching *all* of the label recommendations will be included in the segment.

schema.title: Labels
schema.description:
Optional comma delimited list of relevant labels to include in the segment.
The supplied list of assets will be treated as an "AND" list, so only users
matching *all* of the label recommendations will be included in the segment.

parameters.name: labels

parameters.description:
Optional comma delimited list of recommended action types (same list as event types) 
to use as a recommendations FILTER for the asset list provided. Only asset recommendations
of the provided action types will be included in the segment.

schema.title: Action Types
schema.description:
Optional comma delimited list of recommended action types (same list as event types) 
to use as a recommendations FILTER for the asset list provided. Only asset recommendations
of the provided action types will be included in the segment.

parameters.name: action_types

parameters.description: Minimum weight allowable for asset and label recommendations to qualify for the segment.

schema.title: Min Weight
schema.description: Minimum weight allowable for asset and label recommendations to qualify for the segment.

parameters.name: min_weight

put.description:
Use this method to clear out the in-memery versions of the
processing data sets including program labels, assets, event_types
and the event graph.

event_timestamp.title: Event Timestamp
event_timestamp.description: Time the event occurred in ISO 8601 format

labels.title: Labels
labels.description:
Array of labels associated with instance of the event. 
        These should not be used as asset labels which should be managed separately.

events.title: Events
events.description: Array of events, from minimum of 1 event to maximum 1000 events

weight.title: Weight
weight.description:
The strength of the action recommendation
                for the given user. Higher values mean stronger recommendation.

high_engagement_threshold.title: High Engagement Threshold
high_engagement_threshold.description:
This value is the number of actions establishing a user as 'highly engaged'
            (your best customers) for the purposes of inclusion in the engagement model.

event_relevance_decay.title: Event Relevance Decay
event_relevance_decay.description:
This value is the number of days for events to lose half their weight
            (also called event half-life), implemented as a decay curve over time.
            This value is used to account for recency relevance so newer actions 
            can carry extra weight in calculations.

action_weight_floor.title: Action Weight Floor
action_weight_floor.description:
This value is the minimum user action recommendation weight required 
            for the action to be included in the final recommendations. Higher numbers bring higher
            confidence in the recommendations but also limit the number of recommendations 
            provided.

high_engagement_threshold.title: High Engagement Threshold
high_engagement_threshold.description:
This value is the number of actions establishing a user as 'highly engaged'
            (your best customers) for the purposes of inclusion in the engagement model.

event_relevance_decay.title: Event Relevance Decay
event_relevance_decay.description:
This value is the number of days for events to lose half their weight
            (also called event half-life), implemented as a decay curve over time.
            This value is used to account for recency relevance so newer actions 
            can carry extra weight in calculations.

action_weight_floor.title: Action Weight Floor
action_weight_floor.description:
This value is the minimum user action recommendation weight required 
            for the action to be included in the final recommendations. Higher numbers bring higher
            confidence in the recommendations but also limit the number of recommendations 
            provided.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: An array of key-value pairs containing `label`:`weight`

event_type.title: Event Type
event_type.description: The behavior recommended in the action

weight.title: Weight
weight.description:
The strength of the action recommendation
            for the given user. Higher values mean stronger recommendation.

history_weight.title: History Weight
history_weight.description:
The historical weight of the action
    for the given user, accounting for recency and frequency. 
    Higher values mean greater impact on the recommendations.
    *NOTE: exclude values > 0 to recommend new actions only*

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.description: Time of event in ISO 8601 format

event_type.title: Event Type
event_type.description: The behavior logged in the action

tags.name: Program Configuration
tags.description:
Programs define the operating parameters for a given 
scope of user engagement. *_All events and actions (including labels 
and assets) and are handled within the context of a specific program._* 
Programs are typically aligned to a set of use cases that share 
similar user context. Program configuration options include the dials
and switches for optimizing ActionHub behavior to meet the needs of a given 
use case.

tags.name: Event Logging
tags.description: Operations with engagement events and the event stream.

tags.name: User Actions
tags.description:
_Operations with users, their past, present, and future._
            Users are not directly added to the system. They are identified by `user_id` 
            found in the event stream.

tags.name: Asset Administration
tags.description: Operations with the engagement assets (pages, products, etc.) that make up events.

tags.name: Label Administration
tags.description: Operations to manage the weight of program labels.

tags.name: Segmentation
tags.description: Operations to manage and create segments.

tags.name: System Administration
tags.description:
Functions to support the operating of the overall system including system-wide 
configurations. ADMIN role required.
